alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 4:06PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. .Warm temperatures will bring continued snowmelt flood concerns through the Walker River Canyon. For the West Walker Above Topaz Lake...including Little Walker and Coleville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding of lowlands pasture & rural roads in West Walker River Canyon and Antelope Valley including Walker, Coleville and Topaz California. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 6.0 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 05/30/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 345 PM PDT.
